news.title: Supreme Court pauses order that Trump administration must pay full SNAP benefits
news.summary: The Trump administration tried not to pay for any food stamps in November because of the government shutdown. It now proposes partial SNAP benefits. The government shutdown is now in its third week.

news.title: Warren Buffett Watch: Cash fortress Berkshire closes gap with S&P 500 as AI worries depress Wall Street
news.summary: Berkshire Hathaway's B shares and A shares moved 4.5% higher this week after a strong earnings report last weekend.

news.title: Airlines cancel more than 700 U.S. flights as FAA-ordered shutdown cuts begin
news.summary: The cuts were ordered as air traffic controllers have missed their paychecks. The government shutdown is now the longest in U.S. history.

news.title: Underwater cables are a vital piece of the AI buildout and internet — investment is booming
news.summary: Over 95% of international data and voice traffic travels through subsea telecom cables. Tech giants Meta, Google, Amazon and Microsoft are investing for AI.

news.title: Palantir CEO Karp twice slams short sellers as stock suffers worst week since April
news.summary: Palantir CEO Alex Karp twice confronted short sellers this week as the company's shares suffered a double-digit drop. Palantir's shares have since recovered.

news.title: Here’s what the U.S.-China trade truce really means for the U.S. soybean market
news.summary: China has made a pledge to buy U.S. soybeans over the next few years. Yet the damage may have already been done.

news.title: 4 things worrying investors as U.S. stocks see worst start to a month since April
news.summary: The U.S. stock market is off to its worst start to a month since April. Investors grapple with the longest government shutdown in history, among other worries.

news.title: ‘I’m in a financial mess’: My income was cut in half. Do I sell my $600K home and kiss my 2.9% mortgage rate goodbye?
news.summary: “We can move 10 miles south, where property is much cheaper,” he says. “We’re not going to live in a trailer park. We’ll be in a house.”

news.title: Small businesses say this will likely be the last year they can keep prices from going up
news.summary: Small businesses say 2025 may be the last year they can pull it off. After doing everything they can to keep prices from rising this holiday season, many small businesses say they may not be able to.

news.title: As stocks wobbled, the S&P 500 held a critical threshold. Here’s what history says happens next.
news.summary: The benchmark index has been above its 50-day moving average for 133 sessions, the longest streak since 2007. But that nearly came to an end on Friday.
